intro: Diasperus williamioides, commonly known as the Cape mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. It is often found in mountainous areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Diasperus williamioides is also known for its ability to thrive in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
